Browse the source code of netbsd/external/mit/lua/dist/src/lbitlib.c

1/* $NetBSD: lbitlib.c,v 1.7 2018/08/04 17:30:01 alnsn Exp $ */
2
3/*
4** Id: lbitlib.c,v 1.30.1.1 2017/04/19 17:20:42 roberto Exp
5** Standard library for bitwise operations
6** See Copyright Notice in lua.h
7*/
8
9#define lbitlib_c
10#define LUA_LIB
11
12#include "lprefix.h"
13
14
15#include "lua.h"
16
17#include "lauxlib.h"
18#include "lualib.h"
19
20
21#if defined(LUA_COMPAT_BITLIB) /* { */
22
23
24#define pushunsigned(L,n) lua_pushinteger(L, (lua_Integer)(n))
25#define checkunsigned(L,i) ((lua_Unsigned)luaL_checkinteger(L,i))
26
27
28/* number of bits to consider in a number */
29#if !defined(LUA_NBITS)
30#define LUA_NBITS 32
31#endif
32
33
34/*
35** a lua_Unsigned with its first LUA_NBITS bits equal to 1. (Shift must
36** be made in two parts to avoid problems when LUA_NBITS is equal to the
37** number of bits in a lua_Unsigned.)
38*/
39#define ALLONES (~(((~(lua_Unsigned)0) << (LUA_NBITS - 1)) << 1))
40
41
42/* macro to trim extra bits */
43#define trim(x) ((x) & ALLONES)
44
45
46/* builds a number with 'n' ones (1 <= n <= LUA_NBITS) */
47#define mask(n) (~((ALLONES << 1) << ((n) - 1)))
48
49
50
51static lua_Unsigned andaux (lua_State *L) {
52 int i, n = lua_gettop(L);
53 lua_Unsigned r = ~(lua_Unsigned)0;
54 for (i = 1; i <= n; i++)
55 r &= checkunsigned(L, i);
56 return trim(r);
57}
58
59
60static int b_and (lua_State *L) {
61 lua_Unsigned r = andaux(L);
62 pushunsigned(L, r);
63 return 1;
64}
65
66
67static int b_test (lua_State *L) {
68 lua_Unsigned r = andaux(L);
69 lua_pushboolean(L, r != 0);
70 return 1;
71}
72
73
74static int b_or (lua_State *L) {
75 int i, n = lua_gettop(L);
76 lua_Unsigned r = 0;
77 for (i = 1; i <= n; i++)
78 r |= checkunsigned(L, i);
79 pushunsigned(L, trim(r));
80 return 1;
81}
82
83
84static int b_xor (lua_State *L) {
85 int i, n = lua_gettop(L);
86 lua_Unsigned r = 0;
87 for (i = 1; i <= n; i++)
88 r ^= checkunsigned(L, i);
89 pushunsigned(L, trim(r));
90 return 1;
91}
92
93
94static int b_not (lua_State *L) {
95 lua_Unsigned r = ~checkunsigned(L, 1);
96 pushunsigned(L, trim(r));
97 return 1;
98}
99
100
101static int b_shift (lua_State *L, lua_Unsigned r, lua_Integer i) {
102 if (i < 0) { /* shift right? */
103 i = -i;
104 r = trim(r);
105 if (i >= LUA_NBITS) r = 0;
106 else r >>= i;
107 }
108 else { /* shift left */
109 if (i >= LUA_NBITS) r = 0;
110 else r <<= i;
111 r = trim(r);
112 }
113 pushunsigned(L, r);
114 return 1;
115}
116
117
118static int b_lshift (lua_State *L) {
119 return b_shift(L, checkunsigned(L, 1), luaL_checkinteger(L, 2));
120}
121
122
123static int b_rshift (lua_State *L) {
124 return b_shift(L, checkunsigned(L, 1), -luaL_checkinteger(L, 2));
125}
126
127
128static int b_arshift (lua_State *L) {
129 lua_Unsigned r = checkunsigned(L, 1);
130 lua_Integer i = luaL_checkinteger(L, 2);
131 if (i < 0 || !(r & ((lua_Unsigned)1 << (LUA_NBITS - 1))))
132 return b_shift(L, r, -i);
133 else { /* arithmetic shift for 'negative' number */
134 if (i >= LUA_NBITS) r = ALLONES;
135 else
136 r = trim((r >> i) | ~(trim(~(lua_Unsigned)0) >> i)); /* add signal bit */
137 pushunsigned(L, r);
138 return 1;
139 }
140}
141
142
143static int b_rot (lua_State *L, lua_Integer d) {
144 lua_Unsigned r = checkunsigned(L, 1);
145 int i = d & (LUA_NBITS - 1); /* i = d % NBITS */
146 r = trim(r);
147 if (i != 0) /* avoid undefined shift of LUA_NBITS when i == 0 */
148 r = (r << i) | (r >> (LUA_NBITS - i));
149 pushunsigned(L, trim(r));
150 return 1;
151}
152
153
154static int b_lrot (lua_State *L) {
155 return b_rot(L, luaL_checkinteger(L, 2));
156}
157
158
159static int b_rrot (lua_State *L) {
160 return b_rot(L, -luaL_checkinteger(L, 2));
161}
162
163
164/*
165** get field and width arguments for field-manipulation functions,
166** checking whether they are valid.
167** ('luaL_error' called without 'return' to avoid later warnings about
168** 'width' being used uninitialized.)
169*/
170static int fieldargs (lua_State *L, int farg, int *width) {
171 lua_Integer f = luaL_checkinteger(L, farg);
172 lua_Integer w = luaL_optinteger(L, farg + 1, 1);
173 luaL_argcheck(L, 0 <= f, farg, "field cannot be negative");
174 luaL_argcheck(L, 0 < w, farg + 1, "width must be positive");
175 if (f + w > LUA_NBITS)
176 luaL_error(L, "trying to access non-existent bits");
177 *width = (int)w;
178 return (int)f;
179}
180
181
182static int b_extract (lua_State *L) {
183 int w;
184 lua_Unsigned r = trim(checkunsigned(L, 1));
185 int f = fieldargs(L, 2, &w);
186 r = (r >> f) & mask(w);
187 pushunsigned(L, r);
188 return 1;
189}
190
191
192static int b_replace (lua_State *L) {
193 int w;
194 lua_Unsigned r = trim(checkunsigned(L, 1));
195 lua_Unsigned v = trim(checkunsigned(L, 2));
196 int f = fieldargs(L, 3, &w);
197 lua_Unsigned m = mask(w);
198 r = (r & ~(m << f)) | ((v & m) << f);
199 pushunsigned(L, r);
200 return 1;
201}
202
203
204static const luaL_Reg bitlib[] = {
205 {"arshift", b_arshift},
206 {"band", b_and},
207 {"bnot", b_not},
208 {"bor", b_or},
209 {"bxor", b_xor},
210 {"btest", b_test},
211 {"extract", b_extract},
212 {"lrotate", b_lrot},
213 {"lshift", b_lshift},
214 {"replace", b_replace},
215 {"rrotate", b_rrot},
216 {"rshift", b_rshift},
217 {NULL, NULL}
218};
219
220
221
222LUAMOD_API int luaopen_bit32 (lua_State *L) {
223 luaL_newlib(L, bitlib);
224 return 1;
225}
226
227
228#else /* }{ */
229
230
231LUAMOD_API int luaopen_bit32 (lua_State *L) {
232 return luaL_error(L, "library 'bit32' has been deprecated");
233}
234
235#endif /* } */
